metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4651 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The dissect_wccp2r1_address_table_info function inepan/dissectors/packet-wccp.c in the WCCP dissector in Wireshark 1.12.xbefore 1.12.6 does not properly determine whether enough memory isavailable for storing IP address strings, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
